title: Brahma
summary: Brahma (Sanskrit: ब्रह्मा, romanized: Brahmā) is referred to as "The Creator" within the Trimurti, the triple deity of supreme divinity that includes Vishnu, and Shiva.[1][2][3] He is also referred to as Svayambhu (lit. 'self-born')[4] and is associated with creation, knowledge and Vedas.[5][6][7][8] Brahma is prominently mentioned in creation legends, though there are many varying versions. In some Puranas, he created himself in a golden egg known as Hiranyagarbha.
